thread.title: Baby wallaby Monti settles into new home following death of mother
thread.title_full: Baby wallaby Monti settles into new home following death of mother | Daily Mail Online

author: Jake Polden For Mailonline
title: Baby wallaby Monti settles into new home following death of mother
text:
8 shares 1
View
comments
A baby wallaby is well on the road to recovery following the passing of its mother and was recently moved to a new enclosure in a German zoo.
Monti the six-month-old joey had been under the care of zoo keeper Jens Schnabel before he was transported to Tierpark Berlin yesterday.
The zoo keeper described the young and agile wallaby as a 'problem free child' during the time he spent with the macropod in late June.
Orphaned baby wallaby hops into new enclosure at Berlin zoo Monti the six-month-old joey had been under the care of zoo keeper Jens Schnabel who replicated his mother's care by keeping him in a pouch
To replicate the care of its mother, Schnabel was required to feed the baby wallaby warm milk every two to three hours.
The zoo keeper also carried the young macropod around in a bag, which was used to emulate its own mother's pouch.
 Hilarious moment monkey opens mouth as wide as possible and... The moment driver realises he was target practice:... Travel enthusiast captures rare footage of striated... Over and out! Dramatic footage captures TANK drifting around... Captured on camera, Monti can be seen resting inside its makeshift pouch while posing for photographers.
Schnabel holds the bag with a strap around his neck and later bottle-feeds the joey milk.
The young and agile joey was bottle-fed warm milk by the zoo keeper following the passing of his mother in June
The zoo keeper said: 'A kangaroo receives its milk and has to be fed every two hours in the beginning, which needs to be warm, which is why there is a thermos in the bag.
'This bag is being placed on a hook and it stays there until the next two hours are over and milk is needed again. This is how it's done and it's actually a very problem child in the beginning.'
Now that Monti has been moved to his new enclosure he will embark upon an independent life, which will involve him eating carrots and cucumber by himself and living alongside other wallabies.
Monti was moved to his new enclosure in Berlin and will embark upon an independent life alongside the other wallabies
Tierpark Berlin was founded in 1955 and is one of two zoos located in the German capital.
It hosts more than 7,000 exotic animals, in 160 hectares (400 acres) in the former grounds of the Friedrichsfelde Palace.
As well as wallabies, the zoo is also home to a large number of lions, elephants and rhinos.
Tierpark Berlin is on the former grounds of the Friedrichsfelde Palace and is one of two zoos located in the German capital
